intro: Amsinckia menziesii f. latisepala, commonly known as the broad-sepal orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The inflorescence consists of clustered flowers with five broad, fleshy sepals that are prominent and colorful.
